intro: Lewisia longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf lewisia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Lewisia longifolia is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
